intro: Dombeya kituiensis, commonly known as the Kitui dombeya, is a flowering shrub native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Dombeya kituiensis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive blooms and hardy nature.
